<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 186, 171, 201]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 207, 280, 222]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 186, 907, 202]]<|/det|>
0625/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 208, 907, 223]]<|/det|>
May/June 2011  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 229, 907, 243]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 248, 589, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 313, 388, 330]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 343, 235, 358]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 358, 599, 373]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 373, 892, 403]]<|/det|>
Write your name, Centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 415, 892, 446]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 445, 890, 462]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 474, 556, 491]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 503, 764, 535]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer. Any rough working should be done in this booklet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>

The weight of the basket can be ignored. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 333, 665, 351]]<|/det|> At equilibrium, the pivot is nearer to the weight \(W\) than to the baby. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[171, 359, 821, 567]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 580, 379, 598]]<|/det|> What is the weight of the baby? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 609, 134, 626]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 609, 255, 626]]<|/det|> less than \(W\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 636, 134, 653]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 636, 265, 653]]<|/det|> more than \(W\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 662, 134, 680]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 662, 175, 680]]<|/det|> W <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 689, 134, 707]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 689, 293, 707]]<|/det|> impossible to tell <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 733, 96, 751]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 733, 544, 751]]<|/det|> Which statement about mass and weight is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 761, 134, 778]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 761, 428, 778]]<|/det|> Mass and weight are both forces. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 787, 134, 805]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 787, 440, 805]]<|/det|> Neither mass nor weight is a force. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 814, 134, 832]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 814, 327, 832]]<|/det|> Only mass is a force. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 841, 134, 858]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 841, 336, 858]]<|/det|> Only weight is a force.
